alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 10:07PM EDT until September 04 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Clark, Floyd and Harrison. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Jefferson and Oldham. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisville, Jeffersonville, New Albany, St. Matthews, Shively, Prospect, Corydon, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills and Audubon Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
